description: How to apply to have your child returned if they've been abducted, or arrange contact or enforce a court order in EU, Hague Convention and non-Hague Convention countries

details.body:
Contact the police if a child you’re responsible for is at risk of being taken out of the UK without your consent.

If you live in England or Wales, find out who to contact if you want to:

  • try to get your child returned if they’ve been taken abroad or are being kept abroad without your permission
  • arrange contact with your child who is in another country
  • get a court order for contact enforced

If your child normally lives in:

  • Scotland, contact the Central Authority for Child Abduction in Scotland
  • Northern Ireland, contact the Courts and Tribunals Service
  • a country outside the UK and they’ve been taken to England or Wales, contact the Central Authority in your country

nodes.title: Is your child in one of the following countries?

options.label: Get your child returned or arrange contact
Enforce an existing order for contact

nodes.title: What do you want to do?

options.label: Enforce a court order for contact

nodes.title: What do you want to do?

nodes.body:
The International Child Abduction and Contact Unit (ICACU) can help if your child is:

  • under 16
  • living in an EU country

Your application will be handled under an international agreement on child abduction called the 1980 Hague Convention.

Documents you’ll need to provide

Provide the following if you have them:

  • photographs of your child and a copy of their birth certificate
  • photographs of the person who has taken the child
  • a copy of your marriage certificate or divorce decree if you have one
  • copies of any court orders concerning the child

How to apply

  1. Fill in the ICACU application form.

  2. Send the form and supporting documents to ICACU - you can scan and email them to icacu@ospt.gov.uk or post them.

There is no fee.

It’s normally quicker to apply by email.

International Child Abduction and Contact Unit (ICACU)
Official Solicitor and Public Trustee
Post Point 0.53
102 Petty France
London
SW1H 9AJ

DX address: 141423 Bloomsbury 7

After you apply

When ICACU get your application they’ll send it to the relevant organisation in the country your child is in. They’ll organise translations of your documents if necessary.

You may need to provide more information to ICACU or the court in the country your child is in - they’ll contact you if you do.

It will take at least 6 weeks to get a decision. It may take much longer, depending on the circumstances.

ICACU cannot guarantee that your child will be returned or that you’ll get contact.

Contact ICACU

Call the enquiry number if you have a query about your application.

General enquiries
Telephone: 0203 681 2756
Find out about call charges
nodes.title: Apply to get a child returned or arrange contact

nodes.body:
The Brexit transition period has ended and new rules now apply on getting your child back from an EU country or arranging contact with them. This page is currently out of date. 

The International Child Abduction and Contact Unit (ICACU) will help you if your child is under 18 and living in any of these countries:

  • Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic
  • Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary
  • Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Lithuania, Luxemburg, Malta
  • Netherlands, Poland, Portugal, Romania,
  • Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden

Your application will be handled under European Union law (sometimes called the ‘Revised Brussels II Regulation’).

Documents you’ll need to provide

You’ll need the following:

  • the original court order for contact
  • copies of any other court orders concerning the child
  • a completed Article 41(1) certificate (filled in by court staff)

Apply through ICACU

  1. Fill in the ICACU application form.

  2. Send the application form, Article 41(1) certificate and supporting documents to ICACU - email them to icacu@ospt.gov.uk or post them.

There is no fee.

It’s normally quicker to apply by email.

International Child Abduction and Contact Unit (ICACU)
Official Solicitor and Public Trustee
Post Point 0.53
102 Petty France
London
SW1H 9AJ

DX address: 141423 Bloomsbury 7

After you apply

When ICACU get your application they’ll send it to the relevant organisation in the country your child is in. They’ll organise translations of your documents if necessary.

You may need to provide more information to ICACU or the court in the country your child is in - they’ll contact you if you do.

It will take at least 6 weeks to get a decision. It may take much longer, depending on the circumstances.

ICACU cannot guarantee that your court order will be enforced.

Contact ICACU

Call the enquiry number if you have a query about your application.

General enquiries
Telephone: 0203 681 2756
Find out about call charges

Apply through the local court

Send your Article 41(1) certificate and supporting documents to the court in the relevant country. They’ll give you information on applying.

Get legal advice from an English-speaking lawyer in the relevant country.
nodes.title: Apply to enforce a court order issued on or after 1 March 2005

nodes.body:
The International Child Abduction and Contact Unit (ICACU) can help if your child is:

  • under 16

  1. Fill in the ICACU application form.

  2. Send the form and the court order to ICACU - email them to icacu@ospt.gov.uk or post them.

There is no fee.

It will take at least 6 weeks to get a decision. It may take much longer, depending on the circumstances.

General enquiries
Telephone: 0203 681 2756
Find out about call charges
nodes.title: Apply to enforce a court order issued before 1 March 2005

nodes.body:
Apply to the International Child Abduction and Contact Unit (ICACU) if your child is:

  • under 16
  • living in Albania, Andorra, Armenia, Denmark, Georgia, Iceland, Montenegro, North Macedonia, Norway, Russia, Serbia, Switzerland, Turkey or Ukraine

Documents you’ll need to provide

Provide the following if you have them:

  • photographs of your child and a copy of their birth certificate
  • photographs of the person who has taken the child
  • a copy of your marriage certificate or divorce decree if you have one
  • copies of any court orders concerning the child

How to apply

  1. Fill in the ICACU application form.

  2. Send the forms and supporting documents to ICACU - email them to icacu@ospt.gov.uk or post them.

There is no fee.

It’s normally quicker to apply by email.

International Child Abduction and Contact Unit (ICACU)
Official Solicitor and Public Trustee
Post Point 0.53
102 Petty France
London
SW1H 9AJ

DX address: 141423 Bloomsbury 7

When ICACU get your application they’ll send it to the relevant organisation in the country your child is in. They’ll organise translations of your documents if necessary.

You may need to provide more information to ICACU or the court in the country your child is in - they’ll contact you if you do.

It will take at least 6 weeks to get a decision. It may take much longer, depending on the circumstances.

ICACU cannot guarantee that your child will be returned or that you’ll get contact.

nodes.title: Apply to get a child returned or arrange contact

nodes.body:
You can apply to the International Child Abduction and Contact Unit (ICACU) if your child is:

  • under 16
  • in Albania, Andorra, Armenia, Bosnia-Herzegovina, Denmark, Georgia, Iceland, Luxembourg, Moldova, Monaco, Montenegro, North Macedonia, Norway, San Marino, Serbia, Switzerland, Turkey or Ukraine

You can also apply to the ICACU if the court order was made on or after 1 November 2012 and your child is:

  • 16 or 17
  • in Albania, Denmark, Georgia, Luxembourg, Monaco, Montenegro, Norway, Russia, Switzerland, Turkey or Ukraine

If you are not eligible to apply to ICACU, contact the court in the relevant country. Get help and advice from an English-speaking lawyer in the relevant country.

How to apply

  1. Fill in the ICACU application form.

  2. Send the forms and supporting documents to ICACU - email them to icacu@ospt.gov.uk or post them.

There is no fee.

It’s normally quicker to apply by email.

International Child Abduction and Contact Unit (ICACU)
Official Solicitor and Public Trustee
Post Point 0.53
102 Petty France
London
SW1H 9AJ

DX address: 141423 Bloomsbury 7

After you apply

When ICACU get your application they’ll send it to the relevant organisation in the country your child is in. They’ll organise translations of your documents if necessary.

You may need to provide more information to ICACU or the court in the country your child is in - they’ll contact you if you do.

It will take at least 6 weeks to get a decision. It may take much longer, depending on the circumstances.

ICACU cannot guarantee that your court order will be enforced.

Contact ICACU

Call the enquiry number if you have a query about your application.

General enquiries
Telephone: 0203 681 2756
Find out about call charges
nodes.title: Apply to enforce an existing court order

nodes.body:
The International Child Abduction and Contact Unit (ICACU) can help if your child is under 16.

Your application will be handled under the 1980 Hague Convention.

Documents you’ll need to provide

Provide the following if you have them:

  • photographs of your child and a copy of their birth certificate
  • photographs of the person who has taken the child
  • a copy of your marriage certificate or divorce decree if you have one
  • copies of any court orders concerning the child

nodes.title: Apply to get a child returned or arrange contact

nodes.body:
The International Child Abduction and Contact Unit (ICACU) can help only if both of the following apply:

  • your child is in Australia, Ecuador or Uruguay
  • you have a court order for contact made on or after 1 November 2012

You cannot get your court order enforced unless you meet both these requirements.

In all other circumstances, you’ll need to apply to the court in the relevant country. Get help and advice from an English-speaking lawyer in the relevant country

How to apply

  1. Fill in the ICACU application form.

  2. Send it with your original court order to ICACU - by email to icacu@ospt.gov.uk or by post.

There is no fee.

It’s normally quicker to apply by email.

International Child Abduction and Contact Unit (ICACU)
Official Solicitor and Public Trustee
Post Point 0.53
102 Petty France
London
SW1H 9AJ

DX address: 141423 Bloomsbury 7

After you apply

When ICACU get your application they’ll send it to the relevant organisation in the country your child is in. They’ll organise translations of your documents if necessary.

You may need to provide more information to ICACU or the court in the country your child is in - they’ll contact you if you do.

It will take at least 6 weeks to get a decision. It may take much longer, depending on the circumstances.

ICACU cannot guarantee that your court order will be enforced.

Contact ICACU

Call the enquiry number if you have a query about your application.

General enquiries
Telephone: 0203 681 2756
Find out about call charges
nodes.title: Apply to enforce an existing court order

nodes.body:
When trying to get a child returned, you can:

  • arrange mediation to help you try to reach an agreement with the other parent - Reunite International Child Abduction Centre have a mediation service
  • check if there’s information about child abduction laws in the country your child has been taken to
  • get legal advice from a family lawyer in the UK approved to deal with family matters
  • get legal advice from a lawyer in the country your child has been taken to
  • start legal proceedings in the courts abroad to have your UK court order recognised, or to get a new court order under the laws of that country - a lawyer in the country your child has been taken to can advise you on your options
  • contact the International Child Abduction and Contact Unit or the Foreign, Commonwealth and Development Office, depending on where your child is

If your child is in Armenia, Dominican Republic, Lesotho or Morocco

Contact the International Child Abduction and Contact Unit (ICACU).

General enquiries
Telephone: 0203 681 2756
Find out about call charges

International Child Abduction and Contact Unit (ICACU)
Official Solicitor and Public Trustee
Post Point 0.53
102 Petty France
London
SW1H 9AJ

DX address: 141423 Bloomsbury 7

If your child is in another country outside Europe

You can contact the Foreign, Commonwealth and Development Office (FCDO).

FCDO Consular Division
Telephone: 0207 008 5000
Find out about call charges

FCDO may be able to:

  • give advice and help you contact the relevant authorities abroad if you have concerns about your child’s welfare
  • contact the authorities abroad to express interest in a case and ask about progress, where appropriate

The FCDO cannot find British national children overseas or guarantee the return of your child, even if a UK court orders it.

Information you might need

When contacting the authorities about the abduction, you might need the following:

  • your child’s name, age and passport details if you have them
  • details of the person who has abducted your child and their relatives
  • information about where your child is, when they left the UK and how they travelled
  • details of any court orders about your child, such as a Child Arrangements Order, a Prohibited Steps Order or a Wardship Order
nodes.title: Apply to get a child returned

nodes.body:
You must apply to the court in the country where your child is living.

Get help and advice from an English-speaking lawyer in the relevant country.
nodes.title: Apply for a court order so you can ask for contact

nodes.body: Report your child as missing to the police or contact your local court to apply for an order to help locate your child.
nodes.title: You don't know which country your child is in

nodes.body:
The International Child Abduction and Contact Unit (ICACU) can help only if both of the following apply:

  • your child is in Armenia, Dominican Republic, Lesotho or Morocco
  • you have a court order for contact made on or after 1 November 2012

You cannot get your court order enforced unless you meet both these requirements.

In all other circumstances, you’ll need to apply to the court in the relevant country. Get legal advice from an English-speaking lawyer in the relevant country.

How to apply

  1. Fill in the International Child Abduction and Contact Unit (ICACU) application form.

  2. Send it with your original court order to ICACU - by email to icacu@ospt.gov.uk or by post.

There is no fee.

It’s normally quicker to apply by email.

International Child Abduction and Contact Unit (ICACU)
Official Solicitor and Public Trustee
Post Point 0.53
102 Petty France
London
SW1H 9AJ

DX address: 141423 Bloomsbury 7

After you apply

When ICACU get your application they’ll send it to the relevant organisation in the country your child is in. They’ll organise translations of your documents if necessary.

You may need to provide more information to ICACU or the court in the country your child is in - they’ll contact you if you do.

It will take at least 6 weeks to get a decision. It may take much longer, depending on the circumstances.

ICACU cannot guarantee that your court order will be enforced.

Contact ICACU

Call the enquiry number if you have a query about your application.

General enquiries
Telephone: 0203 681 2756
Find out about call charges
